body: it never worked in tune with entry-point names

Strange, it warrants investigation, the code seems correct:

https://github.com/pytest-dev/pytest/blob/a9457345eef296dbc2b76152a3471c019f8ebde5/src/_pytest/config/__init__.py#L780-L784

(`consider_preparse` loads based on `-p`)

A full stack trace might help you here, if you haven't seen one already. I think `consider_preparse` is working. It _does_ successfully load the plugin. The problem is that `load_setuptools_entrypoints` then fails because the plugin is already loaded:

```
$ pytest -p pytest_cov.plugin
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/local/bin/pytest", line 11, in <module>
    sys.exit(main())
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/_pytest/config/__init__.py", line 61, in main
    config = _prepareconfig(args, plugins)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/_pytest/config/__init__.py", line 196, in _prepareconfig
    pluginmanager=pluginmanager, args=args
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/pluggy/hooks.py", line 284, in __call__
    return self._hookexec(self, self.get_hookimpls(), kwargs)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/pluggy/manager.py", line 68, in _hookexec
    return self._inner_hookexec(hook, methods, kwargs)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/pluggy/manager.py", line 62, in <lambda>
    firstresult=hook.spec.opts.get("firstresult") if hook.spec else False,
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/pluggy/callers.py", line 203, in _multicall
    gen.send(outcome)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/_pytest/helpconfig.py", line 93, in pytest_cmdline_parse
    config = outcome.get_result()
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/pluggy/callers.py", line 80, in get_result
    raise ex[1].with_traceback(ex[2])
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/pluggy/callers.py", line 187, in _multicall
    res = hook_impl.function(*args)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/_pytest/config/__init__.py", line 652, in pytest_cmdline_parse
    self.parse(args)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/_pytest/config/__init__.py", line 838, in parse
    self._preparse(args, addopts=addopts)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/_pytest/config/__init__.py", line 784, in _preparse
    self.pluginmanager.load_setuptools_entrypoints("pytest11")
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/pluggy/manager.py", line 276, in load_setuptools_entrypoints
    self.register(plugin, name=ep.name)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/_pytest/config/__init__.py", line 311, in register
    ret = super(PytestPluginManager, self).register(plugin, name)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/pluggy/manager.py", line 81, in register
    % (plugin_name, plugin, self._name2plugin)
ValueError: Plugin already registered: pytest_cov=<module 'pytest_cov.plugin' from '/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/pytest_cov/plugin.py'>
{'140500909530360': <_pytest.config.PytestPluginManager object at 0x7fc8eacd9cf8>, 'pytestconfig': <_pytest.config.Config object at 0x7fc8e6ec30b8>, 'mark': <module '_pytest.mark' from '/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/_pytest/mark/__init__.py'>, 'main': <module '_pytest.main' from '/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/_pytest/main.py'>, 'terminal': <module '_pytest.terminal' from '/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/_pytest/terminal.py'>, 'runner': <module '_pytest.runner' from '/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/_pytest/runner.py'>, 'python': <module '_pytest.python' from '/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/_pytest/python.py'>, 'fixtures': <module '_pytest.fixtures' from '/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/_pytest/fixtures.py'>, 'debugging': <module '_pytest.debugging' from '/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/_pytest/debugging.py'>, 'unittest': <module '_pytest.unittest' from '/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/_pytest/unittest.py'>, 'capture': <module '_pytest.capture' from '/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/_pytest/capture.py'>, 'skipping': <module '_pytest.skipping' from '/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/_pytest/skipping.py'>, 'tmpdir': <module '_pytest.tmpdir' from '/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/_pytest/tmpdir.py'>, 'monkeypatch': <module '_pytest.monkeypatch' from '/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/_pytest/monkeypatch.py'>, 'recwarn': <module '_pytest.recwarn' from '/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/_pytest/recwarn.py'>, 'pastebin': <module '_pytest.pastebin' from '/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/_pytest/pastebin.py'>, 'helpconfig': <module '_pytest.helpconfig' from '/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/_pytest/helpconfig.py'>, 'nose': <module '_pytest.nose' from '/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/_pytest/nose.py'>, 'assertion': <module '_pytest.assertion' from '/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/_pytest/assertion/__init__.py'>, 'junitxml': <module '_pytest.junitxml' from '/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/_pytest/junitxml.py'>, 'resultlog': <module '_pytest.resultlog' from '/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/_pytest/resultlog.py'>, 'doctest': <module '_pytest.doctest' from '/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/_pytest/doctest.py'>, 'cacheprovider': <module '_pytest.cacheprovider' from '/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/_pytest/cacheprovider.py'>, 'freeze_support': <module '_pytest.freeze_support' from '/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/_pytest/freeze_support.py'>, 'setuponly': <module '_pytest.setuponly' from '/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/_pytest/setuponly.py'>, 'setupplan': <module '_pytest.setupplan' from '/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/_pytest/setupplan.py'>, 'stepwise': <module '_pytest.stepwise' from '/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/_pytest/stepwise.py'>, 'warnings': <module '_pytest.warnings' from '/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/_pytest/warnings.py'>, 'logging': <module '_pytest.logging' from '/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/_pytest/logging.py'>, 'pytest_cov.plugin': <module 'pytest_cov.plugin' from '/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/pytest_cov/plugin.py'>, 'django': <module 'pytest_django.plugin' from '/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/pytest_django/plugin.py'>}
```

Oh OK, that makes sense now, thanks!

issue.title: Change -p so it is possible to early load setuptools plugins

repository.name: pytest
repository.description: The pytest framework makes it easy to write small tests, yet scales to support complex functional testing

body:
> it never worked in tune with entry-point names

After looking at the code I see what you mean. ðŸ˜… 

Took a stab at a solution in #4727
Just wanted to post here and confirm that when I updated PyTest, `-p` is now working for me like it's supposed to. Thanks for fixing it so quickly!

issue.title: pytest plugins loading order

labels.name: type: question
labels.description: general question, might be closed after 2 weeks of inactivity

repository.name: pytest
repository.description: The pytest framework makes it easy to write small tests, yet scales to support complex functional testing

issue.body: I have `pytest-django` `pytest-dotenv` installed on my machine. Somehow pytest cannot load `pytest-dotenv` first and because of that, I cannot set the `DATABASE_URL` and pytest just uses defaults from django settings and fails to run tests because it tries to run tests with `sqlite3` not `posgre`. I've found this issue https://github.com/pytest-dev/pytest/issues/4718, but for me `-p` part still doesn't seem to work. so everytime i open a new terminal session screen, I need to manually export things in order for pytest to run. Could someone tell me why I cannot set my `pytest` plugin order?
